alert.note: Alert for Cowley (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 7:57PM CDT until May 06 at 11:30PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM CDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of South Central and Southeast Kansas, including the following counties, in South Central Kansas, Butler and Cowley. In Southeast Kansas, Chautauqua, Elk, Greenwood, Labette, Montgomery, Neosho and Wilson. * WHEN...Until 100 PM CDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 757 PM CDT, local law enforcement reported flooding in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... El Dorado, Arkansas City, Winfield, Andover, Parsons, Coffeyville, Independence, Augusta, Rose Hill, Eureka, Neodesha, Fredonia, Cherryvale, Caney, Oswego, Douglass, Towanda, Erie, Chetopa and Sedan. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
